intro: Lisianthius oblongifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf lisianthius, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant features narrow, linear leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Lisianthius oblongifolius is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in arid and semi-arid environments.
